website_summaries.verdict: Wearing the Defy means sending projects in great comfort on day one. Sporting this budget- and beginner-friendly rock climbing shoe also translates to secure ascents, thanks to its super-tenacious outsole.That said, this offering might not be for people who would rather not get stinky feet, or those who scale routes laden with edges. Nevertheless, the Defy is a remarkable Evolv piece—one that delivers climbing goodness without breaking the bank.
pros: Many owners find their Evolv Defy climbing shoes extremely comfortable
According to several wearers, this rock shoe from Evolv provides unbelievable surface grip
The Defy is highly recommended for entry-level climbers, say some of those who have used it numerous times
A decent number of patrons consider the Evolv Defy a super-affordable rock climbing shoe
Its break-in period is virtually non-existent, based on a couple of reports
cons: Its inability to combat odor properly does not sit well with a verified purchaser
An expert who has put the Defy through its paces says that edging is not the shoe’s strongest suit

customer_reviews.title: Solid beginner pair that wears out quickly
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pair of climbing shoes. The best part about these shoes was the price and the fact that they came in size 14. These were great for getting me into climbing but after 2 months of climbing 4-5 days a week I was ready / needed to upgrade (I chose the Tenaya Iati size 14... see my review there). Looking at the shoes now, the toe box is turned up when laying flat and the rubber is pretty worn and rounded. I just don’t think the Trex rubber is as good other brand’s rubber. Good starter pair for big footed beginners though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Too small, order one full size up
customer_reviews.text: I wear around a 9-9.5 sneakers, and use size 9 climbing shoes at climbing gyms. I first ordered a size 9 thinking everyone's "complaints on small fits" were regular people unfamiliar with the snug fit of climbing shoes. However, it was WAY too small and had to curve and jam my feet to wear them, and could not even walk on them. I returned and got a size 10, which fit me real snug like the size 9 rentals I usually climb with! Make sure you order a full size up!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C Paek

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy shoe. It's true to size (or possibly get a half size smaller if you like it a bit tighter) . If at all it has shrunk slightly since I've bought it so take that into consideration. It's not very technical, but it's good for beginner or intermediate climbers. The soles last longer than other shoes I've bought yet it still is quite grippy. This is my second pair and I'll probably buy another when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: kylenetkyle

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, small sizing
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9.5 to 10 in normal shoes, bought 10.5 and they were wayy too small. I couldn't even get my foot inside, had to send them back. Leaving this review for sizing purposes, I measured my foot based on their sizing recommendation and it didn't work out. The shoe quality was excellent. I wish they had fit. For now my climbing gym includes shoes with membership so I'm taking my time to buy
customer_reviews.author: David Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for the price but definitely runs small, even for a climbing shoe. I ordered this for my son who wears a 9.5 and had to exchange for an 11.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: I love them. Sizing up 1
customer_reviews.text: I dont have a lot to compare with as this is my first pairs of climbing shoes; But having used them for months now, I love them. Sizing up 1.5 was perfect for me (I'm a 10 street size, bought 11.5 in these). My only complaint may be that my feet get hot/sweaty in them. I've heard similar complaints of other climbing shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Topher St-Amour

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE
customer_reviews.text: Great all around shoe and way better than my rentals. These run very small so be careful. For example I wear an 8 in vans comfortably and I tried on an 8.5 in these and my toes were curled in half and was very painful. I got a 9 with slight toe curl for a tight fit. They will wear in a little but not much. I do recommend these for comfort and durability but make sure you get the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Jaw

customer_reviews.title: Order 2 sizes up for a snug, perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Order 2 sizes up for a snug, but not extremely uncomfortable, perfect fit. I normally wear a 14 in street shoes but got a 16 in these. My big toe is pressed against the end but not fully curled. Great beginner climbing shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoe - They Run Big
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe and it deserves 5 stars. I love the way it grips the wall and it has a great fit for my foot. They do run smaller shoes that I have bought but they mention that on the page and I decided not to listen so that is not a mark against them. Just something I want others to notice so they don't have to return the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner climber so this shoe fits the bill. I would suggest getting half a size up from your normal shoe size, though. The pain gets pretty bad and I have to remove the shoes after every climbing iteration. I've done years of heavy hiking and forced marches, so my feet aren't exactly the delicate type either.
customer_reviews.author: D.C

customer_reviews.title: Sizing issue
customer_reviews.text: Sizing chart does not help. The reviews and Q&A about sizing is confusing. I normally wear Colehaans size 9; and Addidas size 9.5. This climbing shoes at size 9.5 is not true to size and doubt that it will stretch to size (if it does, you probably would need to wear this everyday to work for 6 months). At size 10.5, my toes are still curled up and toe knuckles are pointed up. Settled for 11.5. I'm no expert climber but I want to enjoy learning how to climb and not think about how much my feet hurt in the middle of the climb.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: runs extremely small
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this shoe, I read a variety of reviews and went ahead and bought a size that I usually wear thinking these were close to true to size. However, these run extremely small. To give you an idea, I had to go up two full sizes to wear a pair that wasn't so tight, that my toes curled. Performance wise, these have been great so far and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Chong

customer_reviews.title: These fit snug just like they were supposed too
customer_reviews.text: These fit snug just like they were supposed too. The fit was spot on. Pick 1/2 size less than your regular shoe and youre good to go with these. As a new climber these were perfect. They hold up well, and provide great grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for beginners. I definitely feel like I got my money’s worth, especially because they came in my size (16).
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. P.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were extremely small for the size I ordered. Had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ckfowler

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing shoe for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I've been climbing in these for exactly a year now. Great shoe, easy to break in and comfortable to wear. A lot better to start off with this than an aggressive shoe for beginners IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shibahara

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Can’t compare to other shoes but I’m super happy with them. They do run 1.5 sizes or so smaller than your regular size, like everyone says
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit!
customer_reviews.text: I am not an overly experienced climber but I know they are supposed to curl your toes slightly. I have a little bit wider foot and I typically wear a 10-10.5 shoe and normally wear either 10.5 -11 in climbing shoes. I've noticed it varies on the climbing shoe. I know they say to wear a size or half size smaller than you normally wear. I would have got a 10.5 but I tried the 11s, and I'm glad I did. They still curl my toes slightly which I was surprised. So overall, I normally wear 10.5 but got an 11 and I am happy with the fit!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: amateur climber
customer_reviews.text: great shoes for rock climbing and/or indoor gyms. definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sch

customer_reviews.title: Solid Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, affordable climbing shoe available in a much larger variety of sizes than standard. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes, great grip and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes, great grip and comfortable. I've gone through a lot of climbing shoes over the years, but these are probably my favorite shoes I've had since my laceup 510s.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what i expected! Nice band and well made,great color choice!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8.5 in street shoes and an 11 in evolv. Couod maybe even go up another half size. Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Grey Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Size up to fit well
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality shoe...I wear a 13 street shoe but the 15 in this shoe fits well. Grips well for solid climbs
customer_reviews.author: G. Barlet

customer_reviews.title: This picture is incorrect! I ordered these shoes thinking ...
customer_reviews.text: This picture is incorrect! I ordered these shoes thinking I was going to get the defy (velco as pictured), but the item is actually for the defy lace. Please update the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Koff

customer_reviews.title: Works great with bouldering though
customer_reviews.text: A little cramped but that’s with all climbing shoes. Works great with bouldering though
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Love em'!
customer_reviews.text: Fourth pair of Evolv Defys. Greater closure strength and same moderate last. Love em'!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up! Stinky!
customer_reviews.text: Size up! I had to get 2 sizes up. Shoe is OK. Very wide and have to cinch down the velcro to get it tight enough. Had to trim down the straps because they were so long at that point that they scraped the mats at the gym. The biggest problem with these is that they STINK. The synthetic material really is a sponge for stank. My previous shoes didn't stink and I've never had any problems with stinky feet. These are so smelly now I probably have to throw away before they even wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scott

customer_reviews.title: but once they get broken in I think they'll be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 street shoe and these fit me just about right for climbing. I've only had them out once so far, but once they get broken in I think they'll be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Greene

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe, true to fit.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the 10.5 up and they fit great. I usually I have problems with shoes being too small or too large in 10.5 but these had just enough tightness to be perfect. I use these in the rock gym, and the velcro is nice for taking them on and off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Too Smal
customer_reviews.text: WAY, WAY too small. Size up at least three sizes.
customer_reviews.author: E. Borders

customer_reviews.title: Street size comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I found that Evolv website suggested fitting was accurate. It reads: "Fit Notes: For performance fit, stay at street shoe. For casual fit, go up half a size from street shoe." The shoe is a good beginner shoe fo sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I've been using them for a year, as a beginner it's serving me well but I guess it's time to a higher level shoes, then I'll be able to make a better comparison. I have to defend it against people who says they stink after a while. My pair don't stink at all,I think that these people don't know how to take care of their stuff, and it's very simple. Don't let them get wet and keep it in a dry cool place, no problem! Pros: good price, comfortable, all around beginner level. Cons: not excellent in any aspect (edging, pockets, cracks).
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Romano

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Have been serving me well for a few months, but they didn't fit as expected and are not 100% comfortable. I'm looking to buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Jose Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I did not buy mine from this seller but o have used these shoes for years and I love them. But I recommend trying on shoes before you buy them. Our feet will be different. Check out an REI to find your size and fit then buy from Amazon, they have better prices
customer_reviews.author: Charles hunt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I had already rented climbing shoes so I knew my size was one size up from my normal shoes. Quality and price for these shoes are great, very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Buffer

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable climbing shoe I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: D. Durst

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good entry-level climbing shoes. I've had my pair for a little under a year now, and they're still going strong. They're comfortable enough to wear for several hours, and the velcro laces are very convenient. The biggest problem I have with them is that the synthetic material inside is EXTREMELY smelly. I've washed them several times now, but I haven't yet found a way to get the smell to go away. I've talked with several other friends who had the same shoes, and they had all had the same problem. Overall, though, very good first pair of shoes for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Carter

product_meta.title: Evolv Men's Defy
product_meta.description: Dont fight gravity, float with it, in the Defy climbing shoe from Evolv. Designed for intermediate and entry-level climbers, the Defy climbing shoe will help you stick to the wall with a grippy rubber outsole (Synthratek VX) and low-profile, wall-hugging shape.Best-selling climbing shoe for beginners and intermediates Low-profile asymmetry - designed for indoor and outdoorSynthratek VX synthetic upper - stretchy and comfortableOdour-resistant mesh liningTrax high-friction rubber outsole - ensures long-lasting tractionMid-sole: MX-P sensitiveProfile: lowRecommended activity - indoor / multi-pitch
feature_bullets: A major upgrade to Evolv's all time best selling shoe
New anti microbial mesh to eliminate odor
New upper material, Synthratek VX, for a soft feel and secure fit

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1 rating4.0 out of 5 stars
